one_reviews_text: I purchase your app for my Rift, works great.  I replaced my Rift with a new Quest 2. it is mental to think someone is going to repurchase your app for a newer hardware, but same system (Facebook). I refuse to purchase it again due to newer version of the quest 2 I have. I would like my purchase moved to my lol same Facebook account under my quest 2. BTW I had to replace my rift due to Oculus not supporting the purchase of new Headset cables.
cool
It is a relly fun game

Love it. Really just Fruit Ninja in VR. Which is nice because I hate when they add stuff no one asked for with games like this. It is about as entertaining as Beat Saber for me and a little more relaxing. Highly recommended as a "Getting into VR" game for family or friends that want to try VR out. Also its a great party VR game when lots of people are over. Easy to play, no time wasting stuff, just chopy chop.

review_title: Good game if you're really bored.
one_reviews_text: Nothing much else to say about the game other than what the title suggests. I would appreciate more content from this game to keep me enganged but I can't expect much else from the price. it was always a solid game to play on mobile. Bringing it to VR was a pleasant experience.

Maybe fun in 2016, but no locomotion and just slicing fruit won't turn many heads in 2020. Performance is nice but could be better - performance is worse than Transference, Pistol Whip, Space Pirate Trainer and it's really hard to see why... I got this on sale, but I'm still going to refund - it's simply not worth more than $5 max. 2c.

review_title: Fruit Ninja, Now With Visible Swords!
one_reviews_text:
Without a doubt, after almost 3 yeears with this game. I can still say this is one of the most fun games in VR that don't use locomotion. The Fruit Ninja team set out to make a great, challenging sword game in VR, and they 100% did just that!

Coming from the 3rd top ninja in survival mode, I can definitely tell you this game is worth every penny you spend on it. (and no in-app purchases? WAHT??!?) They have periodically over the years continued to drop content updates for this game, which is incredible! Like in early October, 2019, after like, 2 years of the game being pretty much the same, they dropped a HUGE update that adds challenge-unlockable swords into the game! That's insane!  And it's a great, simple way to get me excited to play it more again. I want to unlock as many as I can! That's how you drive people to keep playing. Give them more to do! 

And of course the gameplay is amazing. What's not to love? It's fruit ninja, now with actual katanas! XD
It is a super basic game that might be ok as a free app or maybe $0.99.  Not much here, maybe ok to show someone who has never used VR but gets boring within a few minutes.

review_title: Fun like every other Fruit Ninja But...
one_reviews_text: It really fun all the mode are ther but I really wish ther  wound be other sword just like in the mobile game this is why I give 4 stars

review_title: Not worth. Gets boring after 10 minutes
one_reviews_text: The game is without doubt more fun to play on VR compare to smart phone. However it gets pretty much boring after 10 minutes. The defend mechanic against bombs by warding it off with the plane surface of the sword sometimes doesn't work. In stead it will cut the bomb, resulting in instant death. There is no tutorials or campaign mode. When cutting the fruits the vibration is either off or too weak, which doesn't give you the real cutting sensation.

review_title: Never though i will play it
one_reviews_text:
Everyone knows Fruit Ninja. Stupid thing on your phone (for me at least) i bought for money (omg!) and played about 20 mins or so then deleted it and never got back.
I dont remember really how and why i bought this game, probably it was huge discount or so. But... You know mobile Fruit Ninja and Fruit Ninja VR is dam great difference. Suddenlty i found i spent twenty+ hours playing this sh1t =D. I just slashed this fruits again and again and again. This is incredable =).
If you think to have this game prepare to sweat. You will constantly swing your shining swords, no any of treacherous fruits let you to have some rest. The challenge is simple: you or banana. Or pineaple. No other options. This is SPARTA!
Definitely recommend to have this thing in your collection!
The only reason i gave 4 stars instead of 5 is existence of games like Lone Echo or Robo Recall or something like that. Because it is just unfair to give 5 stars to games like Lone Echo and games like Fruit Ninja >_<. Sorry Fruit Ninja, nothing personal.

Review Update V2 Stiill loving this game love the updated scenery etc but my Rift S controllers occasionally go out of bounds knocking all the survival cannons out of bounds causing them to shoot the wall and giving me Xs. I guess it just looses tracking when it goes out of range and just flies across the level ruining the game for me.

**World record broken heres my vid
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kL8X5mKi2Go&t=239s***

I Challenge you to my Fruit Ninja VR Darth Maul Challenge!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fsp2gU4RIVw**
This vid will be updated soon

I enjoyed fruit ninja on my phone for about a month and unfortunately that’s all I enjoyed the VR version for as well.  I still really enjoy the game and go back to it from time to time. It could really use some different challenges and it definitely isn’t worth more than 5 dollars. Wait till it goes on sale if your going to get it

Bought this game on discount for 6,99 Euro. But thats still too much. I played this for maybe 10 mins now and I am already bored. The visuals are fine but could be better. I do not like, that the fruits do not fly high. I always have to look down. Seems like this game does not have a variable height. In fact it has no settings at all. As I am 195 cm tall this bothers me a lot. You have so much space in VR yet all I do is look down. The game is pretty easy as well. It could be more challenging.
To cut fruits does not feel as satisfying, as I expected. If you played Beat Saber you wont be impressed by this game. I would invest more hours in it. 
Might be cool to show it to friends, because they probably know Fruit Ninja and will be able to play this game with no instructions, but this game is wasted just potential. It is currently not worh its price.

review_title: Great game - perfect for VR noobs
one_reviews_text:
I use this game to teach people how VR works, everyone can get it, even 90 year old grandpas.
This is a super fun version of the phone game, with multiple game modes and countless hours of fun.
Get a workout, become a super accurate ninja swordsman, and leaderboard grid, are just a few ways this game is well worth every penny

Not a bad game by any means, GTX 1060 3GB runs it at full 90fps but it has literally no bonus features. Needs at LEAST the unlockable swords from the mobile game. There's just no reason to play unless you really like Fruit Ninja.
It makes really fun, but the motivation takes not very long
Its fun to pop in and out. But it lacks things that could easily makes it better

it could be fun, it's just not. 

you could tie a controller to a fan and get a top score. There's no deepth or skill, just RSI. 

there's no haptic feedback when you hit fruit, the fruit is just thrown randomly and there's really no technique needed to hit it. 

such a boring implementation of what use to be a very inovative game.

+It's Fruit Ninja in VR
+Visuals are fine
+It's a functional game

-Lacks depth 

I wouldn't pay the going rate of $14.99 USD; it's a $4.99 value tops. Maybe there was a point in time that justified the current price, but we're past that point now. For the money there are better experiences out there. It was the first VR game I bought and I mostly bought it because I wanted that hack and slash VR swordplay experience, and there wasn't much else going on at the time. And don't get me wrong it was fun for a minute, but only just, and even at the time I just thought it was OK.  There's a couple game modes, 'Don't drop the Fruit', 'Look out for bomb', and 'Try to hit the fruit for a minute(s)', but none of them are great. 

There is so little to it that I don't feel compelled to play it and I barely even register it as an activity to be experienced now. Honestly I probably get as much if not more out of the phone app, which had (has? ... confirmed, present tense, has) a more aggressive development roadmap, while VR seems to be content as it is (VR doesn't seem to have done anything to add content or run an event besides basic maintainence since January 2017 as far as I can tell), so it's a bit much to pay 15 bucks just to play it in VR.

That said, if you really like Fruit Ninja, you'll probably like Fruit Ninja VR and maybe get it at some point.
This should have been a free demo game, not something I paid for...

review_title: The best hop-in, hop-out game I've found
one_reviews_text:
This takes a decent mobile game and makes it a fantastic VR diversion.  Survival Mode is my favorite, where a hovering basket launches bunches of fruit at you. As time goes on, more baskets fly in. 
It's a great starting point for people who are hesitant to try VR for fear they'll get motion sick. You don't move your feet, but there's plenty of solid hand movement that will get them excited.
One gripe I have is that the bombs in Survival Mode seem much harder than usual to deflect, but I suspect I'm just not thinking of something.

So I´ve owned the oculus for a couple of weeks now. And logically I scanned the internet to find out what the best games are. Especially the gems/essentials you cannot miss out on if you own VR. And titles that have you coming back so they last. Nowhere in the video's or top 10-25 lists did I see Fruit Ninja. While it should be in there and it should be somewhere in the top. 

This game is an absolute must have. It's almost like Fruit Ninja was originally designed with VR in mind. You have so much more control over what you slice and you actually feel like a Fruit Ninja when doing so. It's fun, satisfying and so easy to pick up for everyone. You also don't need to move much (Your feet that is. DO make sure you have enough arm room :P). You'll have the same game modes as on the tablet version. Plus a new survival mode which is challenging and a nice twist on the concept. 

If you own a VR headset, buy this game. Worth every penny!
A lot better in VR
The Survival mode in this game is a blast, but nothing else holds my interest. I've come back to this game multiple times because it just feels that good to play.
You literally get to become a fruit ninja.
If you enjoyed Fruit Ninja on your phone as a fun diversion, you'll love it in VR. The game was pretty much destined to be on the Rift, since the whole concept just begs for AR/VR implementation.
If you've played the mobile game, you're not going to get much more out of the VR version. Worth the money if you're looking to blow off steam (no pun intended) or waste time. Otherwise, keep moving.

Swinging swords is awesome, the most annoying thing is when you are slashing fruit on one side, and your second sword taps a bomb on the other side. i've put one controller down. I'd be nice if i could swap by off hand for a tanto instead of a full length blade, prevent accidents(at least that is what itel myself) Custom blades would be an awesome uipgrade too, if you listening devs. Thanks for the great game too. the survival mode is very fun.
i hit my thumb on the table
Its simple and easy to start. I love to just start it up to blow off some steam.

I will admit that at first glance it might seem like the game has not much to offer because it contains only 4 game modes. 

BUT! This game is the most fun I had with the VR up to this point. 
As a point of reference: I played Dead and Buried and Robo Recall for most of the time. And these game sure are very good aswell. However Fruit Ninja VR made me do work out while having fun. I play a couple of hours every day now and I start to see results. 
And believe me I am not one of these couch potatoes.........you have to swing like you have a sword however (because twisting around with the controller like they would be fans works aswell. But I think personally that is too cheap. I WANT TO FIGHT WITH HONOR! Hahaha)
Exactly what you expect! Tons of fun!

This version of Fruit Ninja blows the rest out of the water. I fell in love with this game becuase of how responsive it is. It would be cool if the developers added different skins for the weapons and maybe even the fruit that pop out of the ground. Survival mode is a blast!!

review_title: One of the better games ive played
one_reviews_text: this is a fun way to spend your time
Iphone game was more immersive.  Effects are lacking.

You can easly get into a sweat playing this. The knocking bombs away and stabbing isn't as easy as the trailer shows it. Some times the bomb will go off even though I could swear I hit it on the flat side and then I would knock the fruits I would try to stab. Other than that this is a real fun and movement of a game. Also of note, its nice it uses the Oculus Avatar system (at least for the hands) need more games that use it.
I can finally be a ninja and slice fruits with swords. 10/10
amazing besides me smashing my light bulb     xD

You would think the swords in game would align with the handles of the touch controlers, but you'd think wrong. They're oddly misaligned causing some accidental bomb hits. I often go to bump a bomb off to the side and it explodes, and I go to cut a fruit and it gets bumped off the screen. The new game mode is an interesting concept, but to make it challanging, the flying robots shoot the fruit in a way that forces you to impossibly contort your arm to not lose. All that being said, I did have good fun flailing around dicing up fruits but never for more than a few minutes until the novelty wears off. Would I recommend purchasing this game? Maybe if you have kids who love fruit ninja and want to play with your $600 toy, or want to watch your drunk friend flop around punching your furniture. Do not buy it full price.
good

this is a great vr version of fruit ninja, and I feel as though this game left nothing out. It does the franchise justice, and it succeeds at being a fun arcade experience that you can jump into over and over. 
Just like other Fruit Ninja games. 
It's appropriately priced, and I'm not disappointed in the slightest. And that's saying a lot when most vr games are garbage. 
Bravo, Fruit Ninja!

review_title: your girl friend will like it
one_reviews_text: My girl friend doesn't like play computer games, but she likes this game so much.

review_title: The logical progression of fruit ninja
one_reviews_text: if you played fruit ninja on the phone, then the tablet, then the arcade, and then the kinect, this is the next step up. No big changes except the addition of a vr-centric survival mode alongside the classic survival. So if you like fruit ninja this one's a no-brainer.

This is one of those games that doesn't require much of a review, because you already know what fruit ninja is and you can probably guess what it's like in VR.  Only added comment, gameplay is rather shallow, as one would expect.
Love it!

I find that this game is good in short bursts because it is physicallyt demanding if you put everything into each round. The tracking is spot on and it feels good to play. Well done to the devs. Maybe a little overpriced for what you get. I would have paid $10 if I was asked to price the game.

The best thing about this game are the two beautiful sword models in each hand and the ease with which they move precisely and make cuts precisely where you choose to cut. But the lack of resistance in the motion controls definitely makes it feel odd compared to a real sword - more like a light saber. It's quite challenging, throwing a huge number of fruit at you in quick succession, and I can't even begin to approach the top of the leaderboards. The main issues: very little tutorialization, you're dumped in the deep end; and for those who aren't competitive on the world stage it's not very satisfying to get your rank from #212 to #190. Seems designed for Fruit Ninja veterans who are already familiar with the modes and the techniques and the bonuses, which are all unexplained until you try them.
First few min are fun but just too shallow for me. I bought for demos and parties.

I picked this up as I thought it was something my 3 year could play in daddys goggles, he loves it. I started messing around on it nearly 2 hours ago and only just managed to drag myself away from it.
If you've played the simple addicting game before you know its a quick challenge so it is what it is. I've played it on Microsoft Kinect and it was a blast, this takes it a step further!

While this fulfills its role as Fruit Ninja in VR, it is just a straight port from the original phone game gameplay. In addition there is no haptic feedback which spoils the immersion - see the NVidia Funhouse swords for how to do it right.
Hi I cant even get the game to open its frozen on the monitor. In the rift there isnt any response it has issues opening the game.
What can I say, I just love each version of this game... Mobile, Kinetic and now Oculus Riff, that is just perfect, the best game for parties and for soloing. You guys always rocks with this game!!!
It doesn't work and no response from service.
Freezes on startup, no response from customer support in over a week
Overly simplified, doesn't real add anything beyond swinging a sword.

Fruit Ninja is just a fun game through and through. Even on mobile this game was great but add in VR swords you can swing like a real sword and it's on a whole nother level. Also I find it's the most physically tiring game of all the ones I've played so if being active and keeping fit was a part of why you got into VR this game is a must have.

But alas I can't. Not because this game is poor in any way, shape or form. In fact it is one of my best ever game purchases, I just wish it had a bit more content and options. More levels or game types would be a great addition and maybe a way to access leaderboards or personal stats please and you shall have your 5 stars!
This is a wonderful game and a fantastic demonstration of Oculus system capability.  Very addicitive.  Love it!! So Accurate and fun adn it will make you hungry :)
Very cool Game for vr its lots of Fun.I would give 5 Stars but i miss Options and more Gamemodes.What i really like about it is how intuitive it plays and feels Great.

This is one of those games I imagine will be forgotten as VR develops as a platform, but for now it's constructed well enough and is fun in short bursts.

Oh, and 15 dollars is insane.  If you can get it on sale do that.

review_title: Very easy to use and fun. Just a few nit
one_reviews_text: I had always heard about Fruit Ninja but never tried it myself. But as I now got Touch I figured I had to try it out. And boy am I out of shape! 15 min in and I'm already  working up a sweat. The gameplay is very straight forward (altough I thought I was supposed to be able to fling the bombs away, but everytime I try they explode in my face. Must be some technique I'm missing). There is a bit of mystery meat navigation going on and I keep hitting the menu and oculus buttons when things get frantic which is never a problem in other games. But all in all. It is a fun little game that you can whip out and have some fun with I think.

The swords are very responsive and chasing the leaderboards in the various modes is good fun.

Also a great game to introduce people to VR.

review_title: A fast way to get a craving for fruit!
one_reviews_text: Some juicy fruitsalad here. You could want more, but you have to appreciate how the original cellphone game (and a Kinect version) is growing into a whole series of good quality slicing games. Multiple modes like with the originals. Enjoyable, simple, fun.
Simple concept but surprisingly engaging - I'm surprised and only mildly embarrassed by how many hours I've logged slashing fruit out of the air with my deadly blades.

review_title: fun game that could be great
one_reviews_text: this just needs haptics. otherwise this game is exactly what i thought i was buying. my family and i will enjoy many hours of this eventually, but haptics can add so much to the game.

review_title: Its Simply Fruit Ninja in VR
one_reviews_text: Its too muchy fun. MY family and I can't have enough of it. Its a game everyone can play and slowly improve on. We always compete on who can get the highest score and try to best each other. Truly a MUST have game for the holiday season or family and friends get togethers.
Greaete VR experiance!
This Game will give you a good workout if your looking to sweat and have fun doing it this is the game for you.
I found a reason to exercise now!
Very fun and quite a workout.
It's fruit ninja... in VR... exactly what you would expect.
It was like I expected, fun, and I swet a lot
